title: "Becoming A Troubling Norm": Supriya Sule Slams Air India For Flight Delay
content: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP-SP) MP Supriya Sule on Friday slammed Air India after her flight was delayed for over an hour at the Delhi Airport.

title: "Would Love Reconciliation With My Family," Says Prince Harry
content: Britain's Prince Harry said he would love to be reconciled with his family in an interview with the BBC on Friday.

title: Pakistan UN Envoy's "Kinetic Action" By India "Imminent" Warning
content: Tension has been building up in the region following last month's terrorist attack in Pahalgam, for which The Resistance Front, a front outfit of the Pakistan-based Lashkar-e-Taiba, claimed responsibility.

title: "Failure At Age Of Eating Chocolates": Tamil Nadu Minister On Big CBSE Move
content: Tamil Nadu Education Minister Anbil Mahesh Poyyamozhi slammed the CBSE for failing Class V and VIII students under the National Education Policy NEP 2020.

title: 1 More Arrested In Assam For 'Pro-Pakistan' Remarks
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has said that the state police have arrested another individual over alleged charges of supporting Pakistan.

title: Ghaziabad Society Basement Flooded Due To Damaged Drain, Residents Hold Protest
content: Enraged by the builder's alleged inaction following the collapse on Thursday, the residents of the Prateek Grand City blocked a road in the area.

title: Singapore Votes In Test Of Ruling Party's Monopoly
content: Singapore is holding an election on Saturday almost certain to perpetuate the unbroken rule of the People's Action Party, in a test of public approval for its new PM as the city-state braces for economic turbulence from a global trade war.

title: Polls Open In Australia As Cost Of living, Housing Top Voters' Concerns
content: The election, Albanese said on Friday, has come down to a choice between the certainty of Labor or the conservative Liberal-National coalition's "cuts and chaos".

title: US's Central Intelligence Agency To Cut 1,200 Jobs: Report
content: The CIA plans to shrink its workforce by some 1,200 positions, while other intelligence agencies will also shed thousands of jobs, the Washington Post reported Friday.

title: US To Stage Military Parade On June 14, Trump's Birthday
content: The United States will stage a military parade on June 14 to mark the 250th anniversary of the founding of the US Army, the White House said Friday, with the event also falling on President Donald Trump's 79th birthday.

title: S Jaishankar Speaks To EU Counterpart After Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Friday spoke to his counterpart from European Union Kaja Kallas and discussed the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Seven Dead In Fiery US Van Crash Near Yellowstone
content: A fiery crash involving a passenger van near Yellowstone National Park has left seven people dead, US police said Friday.

title: "Restore Peace, Security And Constitutional Order In Manipur": Meitei Alliance
content: An influential global umbrella body of Manipur's Meitei community today appealed to the central government to take immediate and decisive action to end the suspension of operations (SoO) agreement with Kuki militant groups and take firm steps.

title: "If India Attacks Pak, Bangladesh Should...": Muhammad Yunus Aide On Northeast
content: A former Bangladesh army officer and close aide of Chief Adviser Muhammad Yunus has suggested that Dhaka should collaborate with China to occupy India's northeastern states if it attacks Pakistan in response to the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: "Visit Pak And Check": BJP After Congress MP Demands Surgical Strike Proof
content: Days after the Congress asked its leaders to stick to the party line on the Pahalgam terror attack its MP Charanjit Singh Channi has found himself at the receiving end of a volley by the BJP after demanding proof of the 2016 surgical strike.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: EAM Jaishankar speaks to European Union counterpart Kaja Kallas
content: European Union urges India and Pakistan to show restraint and pursue dialogue amid rising tensions over Pahalgam attack

title: Pahalgam terror attack LIVE: Pakistan says it has right to seek UNSC meeting
content: The Congress Working Committee urged the Narendra Modi government to “isolate and penalise Pakistan for its continued export of terror”

title: Instagram accounts of Babar Azam, Rizwan and many other Pakistani cricketers blocked in India
content: Additionally, the account of Pakistan's former Prime Minister and cricket captain Imran Khan is also now inaccessible in India

title: PM Modi disappointed people of Andhra Pradesh yet again: Congress leader Shivaji
content: A.P. Congress Committee V-P criticises Prime Minister for lack of financial aid during Amaravati visit, exposing “double-engine government claims”

title: Relaunch of Amaravati works marks dawn for a new Andhra, says Minister
content: “Amaravati is the capital of dreams. Every citizen of the State can proudly raise their head. The new capital will stand as the crowning jewel for future generations.”

title: Fire mishap near Prime Minister’s public meeting venue in Andhra Pradesh creates panic
content: Plastic pipes dumped in the open place have caught fire, and the cause of it is not known immediately, says official

title: Yet another lost-in-translation moment for PM
content: The Prime Minister took a dig at the India bloc deviating from the original speech which was handed over to the the translator by the Prime Minister’s Office in advance

title: High Court dismisses criminal petition filed by retired IPS officer T. Prabhakar Rao
content: The ‘absconding officer’, whose passport had been revoked by the Union government recently, is presently hiding in United States of America.

title: NCW takes suo moto cognizance of ‘House Arrest’ web show, warns platforms to be ‘careful’ about women’s dignity
content: The NCW said it found the content to be “deeply disturbing” and a blatant violation of women’s consent and dignity.

title: Indian Air Force showcases aerial might as fighter jets soar over under construction Ganga Expressway
content: Hundreds of spectators present at the spot witnessed roar of engines and high-precision aerial manoeuvres with live commentary providing insights into the technical capabilities and strategic roles of each aircraft.

title: Pakistan continuing its campaign of ‘state sponsored terror’ in Balochistan: Assam CM
content: Systematic extrajudicial killings in Balochistan — commonly known as ‘kill and dump’ — remain one of the darkest chapters in Pakistan’s human rights record

title: Smoke engulfs Kozhikode MCH casualty, patients evacuated
content: The initial assessment of the fire services is that a short circuit might have caused the fire. Health Minister Veena George has ordered an inquiry into the incident.

title: BBMP reports 68 fallen trees as rains continue in Bengaluru
content: BBMP Chief Commissioner M. Maheshwar Rao visited the civic body’s control room and the Integrated Command and Control Centre (ICCC) on Friday evening.

title: Pahalgam fallout: India plans drive to starve Pakistan of funds from global agencies
content: India is escalating its efforts against Pakistan, urging international bodies like the IMF to re-evaluate financial aid due to alleged support for terrorism. New Delhi seeks a review of IMF loans, including a recent $1.3 billion climate resilience loan, and is engaging with the World Bank and Asian Development Bank.

title: Int'l students in US fight back, file class-action suit against SEVIS terminations
content: International students, largely from India, are challenging ICE's policy allowing SEVIS terminations based on visa revocations, arguing it's unlawful and violates due process. The lawsuit, filed against ICE, DHS, and the Secretary of State, seeks to restore students' immigration status and strike down the new ICE policy. They claim the policy was implemented without proper procedure and exceeds ICE's authority.

title: Sundar Pichai makes an ‘Apple announcement’ under oath : Tim Cook was trying to....
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai confirmed under oath that Gemini, Google's AI chatbot, is expected to be integrated into Siri by mid-2025. Discussions with Apple CEO Tim Cook included Gemini app distribution, with Cook indicating more third-party AI models would be incorporated into Apple Intelligence later this year.

title: Railway cops could have prevented 2002 Godhra incident: HC
content: The Gujarat High Court upheld the dismissal of nine railway police constables who were assigned to patrol the Sabarmati Express on February 27, 2002. They returned to Ahmedabad early on another train, and later that day, the Sabarmati Express was torched near Godhra, killing 59. The court dismissed their reinstatement pleas, citing dereliction of duty and false entries in records.

title: Pahalgam fallout: European carriers start avoiding Pakistani airspace
content: Following Pakistan's airspace restrictions for Indian airlines, several European carriers, including Lufthansa, Air France, British Airways, and SWISS, are now avoiding Pakistani airspace. This rerouting, prompted by safety concerns and NOTAMs indicating unavailable airways, adds up to an hour to flight times for routes like Munich-Delhi and Rome-Delhi, as airlines prioritize passenger and staff safety.

title: Apple CEO Tim Cook on made in India iPhones: 'We do expect majority…'
content: Apple CEO Tim Cook announced a significant shift in iPhone production, designating India as the primary manufacturing hub for US-bound devices. This strategic move aims to mitigate potential tariff impacts amid trade tensions. While diversifying production, Apple emphasizes that China remains crucial for products sold outside the US, highlighting its importance in the global supply chain.

title: Rahul Gandhi forced PM Modi's hand on caste census, claims Congress
content: Congress celebrates Rahul Gandhi's persistent advocacy for a caste census, claiming it forced the Modi government's hand after 11 years of resistance. The party plans to amplify its role in achieving caste enumeration through rallies and campaigns, pushing for caste quotas in private institutions and the removal of the 50% reservation cap.

title: After LNG, government may hike fertiliser imports from US
content: India is considering increasing fertiliser imports from the US to address trade imbalances and reduce reliance on countries like China and Russia. This move aligns with efforts to negotiate a trade agreement with the US, seeking better access for Indian exports in exchange for increased imports of American goods, including automobiles and farm products.

title: Open till 7pm? RBI panel calls for extending money market hours
content: An RBI panel suggests extending money market hours to 7pm, aiming to provide banks with greater flexibility in managing liquidity and accessing funds. This shift addresses the expansion and increased complexity of India's financial markets since 2019. The proposal includes adjustments to trading and settlement windows for various instruments, along with changes to the liquidity adjustment facility auction timings.

title: Trump 100 days in office: White House shares Apple CEO's thanks note
content: Apple CEO Tim Cook lauded President Trump's emphasis on boosting U.S. semiconductor manufacturing during a business executive gathering. Cook highlighted Apple's dedication to the American economy, referencing their substantial $500 billion investment plan over the next four years.

title: Raid 2 box office day 2: Ajay Devgn’s crime drama mints over Rs 11 crore
content: Ajay Devgn's 'Raid 2' has made a strong start at the Indian box office, earning over Rs. 30 crore in its first two days. The film, directed by Raj Kumar Gupta, opened with Rs. 19.25 crore on Thursday, boosted by a partial holiday and franchise popularity. While Day 2 saw a drop to Rs. 11.

title: HC order reunites Pak woman with CRPF trooper husband
content: Meenal Ahmed Khan, a Pakistani national, was reunited with her CRPF trooper husband in Jammu after the J&K high court intervened to prevent her deportation. She entered India on a tourist visa and applied for a long-term visa as an Indian citizen's wife.

title: IAF wants surveillance UAVs that can fly in stratosphere
content: Amidst ongoing border tensions, the Indian Air Force (IAF) is seeking to bolster its surveillance capabilities by acquiring three High-Altitude Platform System (HAPS) aircraft. These unmanned 'pseudo-satellites' will operate in the stratosphere, providing persistent intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance (ISR). The IAF has issued a request for information, aiming for delivery within 18 months.

title: Pahalgam Terror Attack Live Updates: Pakistan Violates Ceasefire For Eighth Consecutive Time
content: Pahalgam Terror Attack Live Updates: Pakistani troops continued ceasefire violations along the Line of Control (LoC) for the eight consecutive night on Thursday.

title: US Man Gets 53 Year Jail For Hate Crime That Killed Palestinian Child: Report
content: A man from Illinois was sentenced on Friday to 53 years in prison after a jury convicted him of the murder of a 6-year-old Palestinian American boy and the severe wounding of his mother in an October 2023 hate crime stabbing, according to reports.

title: Graduate Arrested For 'Harassing' Minister Pankaja Munde Over Phone: Police
content: The cyber wing of the state police on Friday apprehended a 25-year-old engineering graduate for allegedly harassing Maharashtra environment minister Pankaja Munde with repeated phone calls and messages, an official said.

title: Mark Carney Vows To Transform Canada's Economy
content: Prime Minister Mark Carney promised Friday to oversee the biggest transformation of Canada's economy since the end of the Second World War to enable it to "stand up" to Donald Trump.

title: Trinamool MP Yusuf Pathan seeks Home Minister’s intervention over alleged assault on migrant workers from Bengal in Odisha
content: Mr. Pathan wrote in the letter addressed to the Home Minister that the systematic targeting of workers from West Bengal, based on their regional identity, especially for those from the Muslim community is deeply troubling.

title: VHP condemns attacks on Kashmiris, but says they will not stop those speaking against ‘jihad’
content: Pahalgam attack makes it clear that terror has a religion, says VHP chief; citing an incident from the Ramayana, Mr. Kumar says India may be awaiting the right opportunity to “retaliate” against the attack

title: The Hindu Huddle: Can ethics keep pace with the rapid evolution of AI?
content: AI can be used for surveillance, for generating deepfakes, and for spreading disinformation — all areas already rife with ethical concerns; these are some of the questions that will be discussed during The Hindu Huddle session titled ‘AI for all? The dream of a democratised and ethical technology’ to be moderated by author Manu Joseph

title: AIADMK’s executive committee ratifies the party’s alliance with BJP
content: Expressing its wish that the coalition would become a “victorious alliance”, the committee said a front was being formed by like-minded parties to defeat the “common adversary” — the Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam — by ensuring that anti-DMK votes did not get split

title: Pahalgam fallout: Fearing India hit, Pak empties out terror launch pads off LoC
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, intelligence reports indicate that numerous Pakistani terrorists have retreated from launchpads in Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (POK) to deeper locations within POK and Pakistan. This withdrawal comes amid fears of retaliatory strikes by Indian forces, reminiscent of the 2019 surgical strikes.

title: Trump 1, Xi 0? US draws first blood, China signals readiness for tariff talks
content: China is considering US proposals for trade talks. This follows economic strain from US tariffs. Factory activity and exports in China have declined. Beijing signals openness to dialogue. However, it warns against coercion. Markets react positively to the news. There is hope for a thaw in the US-China trade standoff. The future of negotiations remains uncertain.

title: No more offensive remarks, Ramdev pledges in Delhi HC in sharbat case
content: Yoga guru Ramdev has assured the Delhi High Court that he will refrain from making disparaging remarks or posting similar social media content, like his "sharbat jihad" comments against Hamdard's Rooh Afza. This commitment follows a lawsuit by Hamdard, alleging Ramdev's promotion of Patanjali's Gulab Sharbat included claims that Rooh Afza's profits funded religious institutions.

title: Snakes in the backyard: How Pakistan admitted it's 'terroristan'
content: But to understand how we got there, and why it still matters in 2025, rewind a little. To a quiet garrison town called Abbottabad, where Osama bin Laden once lounged in his compound, sipping chai not far from Pakistan’s elite military academy. That scene wasn’t fiction — it was a living embodiment of the double game Forsyth wrote about.

title: 'Itne to Virat Kohli ke paas bhi nahi honge': Vaibhav Suryavanshi hilariously trolled
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old prodigy, captivated the IPL 2025 with a record-breaking century against Gujarat Titans, leading Rajasthan Royals to a thrilling victory. However, he soon experienced the unpredictable nature of cricket with a subsequent duck against Mumbai Indians. Cricket icon Kapil Dev has advised patience in nurturing the young talent, emphasizing the need for time and careful development.

title: Saeed shielded, madrassas shut: Inside Pak's panic over Pahalgam fallout
content: Following the Pahalgam attack, India took strong actions. Pakistan fears a potential Indian strike. Security around Hafiz Saeed is heightened. Pakistani media reported false Indian incursions. Schools near the Line of Control are conducting drills. Residents are stocking supplies. Tourist spots are deserted. The US is urging de-escalation and supports India. Pakistan is bracing for possible escalation.

title: IPL 2025: Gill leads from the front as GT crush SRH
content: Shubman Gill's explosive 76 propelled Gujarat Titans to a commanding 38-run victory over Sunrisers Hyderabad. Gill's aggressive batting, supported by Sai Sudharsan and Jos Buttler, helped GT post a formidable 224/6. Prasidh Krishna's economical bowling, including the crucial wicket of Travis Head, stifled SRH's chase, despite Abhishek Sharma's valiant effort.

title: What Sullivan’s firing means for Crosby’s future in Pittsburgh Penguins
content: Mike Sullivan’s firing has left Sidney Crosby’s future with the Penguins in question. As the team enters a rebuild under Kyle Dubas, Crosby, who’s always stayed loyal to Pittsburgh, might now be at a crossroads. With a shift in direction, could the longtime captain consider leaving? This article explores how Sullivan’s departure could impact Crosby’s commitment to the team.

title: Caught on camera: Mike Waltz using less secure version of Signal app
content: Mike Waltz faces scrutiny after a photo revealed his use of TM SGNL, a modified Signal app, raising security concerns due to potential encryption compromises. The images, captured at a White House meeting, displayed conversations with high-ranking officials like JD Vance and Marco Rubio.

title: 3 Indians sentenced to death in Indonesia: Delhi HC asks MEA to act
content: The Delhi High Court has instructed the Indian Consulate in Indonesia to provide legal aid and ensure communication between three Indian nationals sentenced to death for narcotics offences and their families. The court's directive follows a petition by the men's wives, highlighting their financial constraints and the urgency for an appeal.

title: Prince Harry says he wants to ‘reconcile’ with royal family
content: Prince Harry, residing in the US since 2020, has voiced his desire for reconciliation with the Royal Family following a legal defeat concerning his UK security. He revealed a strained relationship with his father, the King, due to the security dispute, expressing a wish to end the conflict.

title: Glove or ball? Shubman Gill's heated exchange with umpire
content: Shubman Gill's controversial run-out sparked outrage during Gujarat Titans' IPL clash against Sunrisers Hyderabad. The third umpire's decision, based on a perceived deflection after Heinrich Klaasen's glove contact, left Gill visibly furious. Despite the contentious dismissal, Gill had already blazed a trail with a sensational 76 off 38 balls. ​​​The dismissal looked extremely tight and was sent upstairs for review.

title: Erstwhile Visakhapatnam poised to be India’s largest steel-producing district
content: With the Centre’s bailout package and other efforts being put in to restore Visakhapatnam Steel Plant to its full production capacity, and ArcelorMittal preparing to set up its unit in Anakapalli district, the potential combined production capacity could be a record 25.10 MPTA, the largest in any district in India, and that their products are complementary is the icing on the cake

title: Calcutta HC tells Police Commissioner to file report on attack on lawyers, issues contempt notices to eight protestors
content: The three-judge Bench also directed the police chief to ensure protection to members of the legal profession and prevent such incidents from recurring

title: Pakistan armed forces hold a series of exercises
content: The armed forces have launched military exercises near the Line of Control and in Arabian Sea, showcasing advanced weaponry; several air traffic routes between Lahore and Islamabad closed

title: Teach Pakistan a lesson for Pahalgam, says Congress Working Committee
content: This is a time for demonstrating our collective will as a nation to teach Pakistan a lesson and curb terrorism decisively, says the CWC

title: India set to become MICE tourism capital of the world, says Union Culture Minister
content: The government and private exhibition industry must collaborate to establish India as a centre of MICE tourism, says Gajendra Singh Shekhawat

title: Supreme Court orders return of Ph.D. scholar Ramadas to TISS
content: A Bench headed by Justice Dipankar Datta gave relief to Mr. Ramadas, who had challenged his suspension and ban from entering any TISS campus.

title: Odisha govt. orders probe into Puri Jagannath priests’ role in West Bengal temple ceremony
content: The probe will also find out if leftover timber procured for the Nabakalebara rituals at the Puri Jagannath Temple in Odisha was used to carve the idols of the sibling deities at a new Jagannath temple complex in Digha, West Bengal

title: Districts outshine Kolkata, boys outperform girls in Bengal Class 10 board exams
content: Even though more female students appeared in this year’s Class 10 exams, girls recorded a lower success rate than boys.

title: Activists seek restoration of flagship schemes, focus on health infrastructure
content: The JSA, functioning as the Rajasthan chapter of the People’s Health Movement and supported by a coalition of 70 networks and organisations, has submitted a memorandum to Chief Minister Bhajan Lal Sharma

title: Caste census will improve opportunities for the needy: Nirmala Sitharaman
content: Union Finance Minister says the DMK should not seek political mileage from the census, which will provide data necessary to create opportunities for the less privileged

title: Maharashtra Congress chief criticises State government’s 100-day report card, points to internal rift in Mahayuti
content: Mr. Sapkal claims that CM Fadnavis used the report card to highlight the superior performance of departments under his direct control, while downplaying the efforts of those managed by alliance partners — Shiv Sena and NCP

title: Vizhinjam Port economy to drive India’s growth to new heights: PM Modi
content: PM praises role of private sector in the port sector, commissions India’s first dedicated container transshipment port, built through a PPP between Kerala’s Communist government and an Adani company

title: ITBP team scales Mt. Makalu, fifth highest peak in the world
content: Led by Deputy Commandant Anoop Kumar Negi, and Nihas Suresh as Deputy Leader, the 12-member team was divided into two groups of six climbers each

title: Kashmiris being unfairly targeted in massive crackdown, families being torn apart: Mirwaiz
content: The events that unfolded after the horrendous Pahalgam incident have again shown that whenever such things happen it is the people of Kashmir who bear the brunt and suffer

title: Kolkata Mayor asks to close down all rooftop restaurants in city, three days after a massive blaze claimed 14 lives
content: This comes as another massive fire engulfed a factory in Kolkata on Friday, only a couple of days after the Rituraj Hotel fire which has led to 14 deaths.

title: SCR General Manager inspects Vijayawada, Gunadala railway stations
content: Arun Kumar Jain checks passenger amenities, safety aspects and ongoing works, besides interacting with the staff

title: Exclusive: Neeraj Chopra's 8:20 pm call that gave Asiad hero his big break
content: Kishore Jena, overcoming a recent ankle surgery, aims to qualify for the World Championships by achieving the 85.50m mark at the Doha Diamond League. After a silver medal at the Asian Games, Jena faced injury setbacks, but Olympic champion Neeraj Chopra encouraged him to participate in the upcoming NC Classic in Bengaluru, boosting his morale and focus.

title: Amid divorce rumours with Barack, Michelle says marriage is 'hard'
content: Michelle Obama addresses divorce rumors with humor, emphasizing the commitment she and Barack share after 32 years. She candidly admits marriage is hard work, advising young couples not to give up too quickly and to seek help when needed. The former First Lady highlights the importance of mutual belief and dedication in making a marriage last, despite the challenges.

title: 'Gogoi's children not Indian, probing his 15-day Pak visit': Assam CM Himanta
content: Assam's chief minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has intensified his criticism of Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi, alleging that Gogoi's children are not Indian citizens. Sarma also questioned Gogoi's purported 15-day visit to Pakistan, insinuating suspicious activities. He further claimed to possess evidence and promised to reveal more details regarding Gogoi's international travels before September.

title: India to ask IMF, World Bank to review loans, grants to Pak: Report
content: Following the recent terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir, India is preparing to urge international financial institutions like the IMF and World Bank to reassess their financial aid to Pakistan. This diplomatic push comes before a crucial IMF meeting where Pakistan's financial arrangements will be discussed. India aims to highlight concerns about Pakistan's role in fueling terrorism.

title: Delhi records second-highest May rainfall since 1901
content: Delhi experienced its second-highest May rainfall since 1901, causing widespread disruptions and four fatalities in Najafgarh. The intense downpour, fueled by converging moisture and favorable atmospheric conditions, led to significant flight delays and traffic chaos across the city. Temperatures plummeted, and authorities are addressing waterlogging issues, with similar weather expected to persist for the coming week.

title: 7.4 magnitude strong earthquake strikes Argentina coast
content: A powerful 7.4 magnitude earthquake struck Argentina, triggering a tsunami alert and prompting Chile to issue a tsunami warning, initiating evacuations along its southern coast. President Gabriel Boric urged evacuation of the Magallanes region coastline, assuring that all state resources would be available. Over 1,100 residents were evacuated in Puerto Williams as a precaution, with Antarctic bases also being evacuated.

title: 'No clear strategy': Kharge slams Centre for delayed response to J&K attack
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge criticized the central government's lack of a clear strategy following the Pahalgam terror attack, despite the opposition's unity with the Centre on the matter. He also questioned the timing of the government's agreement to a caste survey, urging vigilance to ensure its proper completion.

title: Virat Kohli breaks silence, reveals why he quit T20Is
content: Following India's T20 World Cup victory in Barbados, Virat Kohli revealed his retirement from T20Is, citing the need for a new generation to gain experience. Kohli, who scored a match-winning 76 in the final, emphasized the importance of providing young players with a two-year cycle to prepare for future World Cups.

title: 'Came in car, pickup truck': How murder accused Suhas Shetty was killed in Mangaluru
content: Tensions are high in Mangaluru following the murder of Hindutva activist Suhas Shetty, prompting police to impose prohibitory orders until May 6. Shetty, a known rowdy sheeter, was attacked by unidentified assailants, leading to his death. The police have launched a manhunt and are investigating the motive, while also working to maintain public order amidst potential unrest.

title: 30 runs in 1 over! Shubman Gill axes pacer after Vaibhav Suryavanshi's carnage
content: Pat Cummins, captain of Sunrisers Hyderabad, decided to bowl first after winning the toss against Gujarat Titans. Sunrisers Hyderabad remained unchanged from their previous match. Gujarat Titans included Gerald Coetzee, replacing Karim Janat. Shubman Gill, Gujarat Titans captain, mentioned they would have also preferred to bowl first. He added that the team is focusing on improving each game.

title: 'No intent behind it': Virat Kohli's viral post keeps fans guessing
content: Virat Kohli addressed a cryptic social media interaction, clarifying it as an algorithmic error with "no intent," sparking speculation among fans. Despite the off-field buzz, Kohli remains focused on his IPL performance, leading Royal Challengers Bengaluru with impressive form, scoring 443 runs in 10 innings. He is a key player as RCB aims for the playoffs against Chennai Super Kings.

title: India blocks Pak PM Shehbaz Sharif's YouTube channel
content: Amid escalating tensions, India has blocked Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif's YouTube channel, intensifying its crackdown on misinformation. This action follows the Pahalgam terrorist attack and targets Pakistani political figures, sportspersons, and media outlets. The government aims to counter anti-India propaganda by blocking channels spreading fake news about sensitive topics like the Indian Army and Kashmir.

title: Manipur ethnic conflict: Security heightened ahead of second anniversary
content: Kuki-Zo organisations will observe May 3 as ‘Separation Day’ with students groups calling for a shutdown; an umbrella body of Meitei organisations will organise a people’s convention to mark the day

title: Baba Ramdev gives undertaking to Delhi High Court on controversial video against rival brand
content: Hamdard National Foundation India filed a plea against Ramdev and his Patanjali Foods Ltd over the controversial remarks

title: WAVES Declaration adopted to promote cultural pluralism and responsible media innovation
content: Member nations at Global Media Dialogue 2025 agree to uphold ethical use of emerging technologies, foster global collaborations, and bridge the digital divide through inclusive media practices

title: Drugs worth ₹547 crore seized, 15 arrested: MHA
content: Bharat is axing down drug cartels with ruthless aggression. The Amritsar Zonal Unit of the NCB axed a drug diversion cartel through a 4-month-long operation across 4 states, says Union Home Minister Amit Shah

title: Southern Railway to upgrade e-vehicle charging facilities and install new ones at several stations across Chennai
content: As part of the initiative, 28 railway stations have been chosen to get the facilities; among these work has already commenced at Light House, Thirumayilai, Velachery, and Kotturpuram

title: Official says half of looted police weapons recovered in Manipur, most during President’s rule
content: Sit-in protests, demonstrations allowed on second anniversary of conflict, but no rallies; of the 6,020 weapons looted from police armouries, 3,000 have been recovered, including 1,750 recovered after President’s Rule, says official

title: Licensed stamp vendors are public servants under anti-corruption law: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court agreed with the High Court’s finding that stamp vendors were public servants but set aside the conviction of stamp vendor Aman Bhatia on the ground that the prosecution did not prove the allegation beyond reasonable doubt.

title: Uttarakhand HC pulls up local administration for ordering ‘illegal’ demolition of house of rape accused
content: The civic body has ordered demolition of the house of the senior citizen accused of raping a 12-year-old that lead to communal tension in the hill town

title: Discover the culinary heritage of Odisha and Southeast Asia at Jaatra, Taj Puri
content: Dining at Taj Puri Resort’s specialty restaurant Jaatra is a , dining isn’t just about eating; it’s ajourney through centuries-old history of trade and culinary transformations

title: NEET-UG 2024: 26 MBBS students suspended for malpractice, 42 candidates debarred for three years
content: NMC and NTA crack down on impersonation, paper leaks; 215 candidates under investigation as CBI probe continues

title: Minorities have reposed faith in the VCK because of its secular push, say leaders
content: Today, the minority communities see the alliance that we are part of as the secular alliance, says VCK general secretary D. Ravikumar

title: Not just heat, April showers also reduced electricity demand in Karnataka
content: The electricity demand this summer season was expected to go beyond 18,500 MW – 19,000 MW, but in April, peak demand was 17,330 MW

title: Man arrested for sending obscene message to Minister Pankaja Munde
content: The accused, identified as Amol Kale, was detained from Bhosari in Pune after police traced his location through the mobile number used for the calls

title: Marandi slams CM Soren for allowing Anurag Gupta to continue as Jharkhand DGP
content: BJP leader asserts that Jharkhand is constitutionally without a DGP for the last two days; points out that instructions given by Mr. Gupta are unconstitutional after the instructions of the Home Ministry

title: Four of a family killed as house collapses in southwest Delhi following heavy rains
content: Heavy rainfall and gusty winds expose fragile urban infrastructure; four dead in house collapse, widespread waterlogging and outages reported across city

title: Amaravati will be developed as world-class capital city as promised: Pawan Kalyan
content: With the three-capital proposal, the previous government watered down the aspirations of people, the Central and State governments now are working together to rebuild the capital, says Deputy CM

title: Uncertainty continues over Anvar’s entry into UDF
content: He appears hesitant to abruptly sever ties with the Trinamool Congress and seems unwilling to join the Congress. A high-level UDF meeting convened in Kozhikode on Friday welcomes Anvar into its fold

title: All set for Gangamma Jathara in Tirupati
content: Around 80,000 devotees are expected to visit the temple during the week-long Jathara, which starts on May 6

title: Thrissur at its energetic best as Pooram draws near
content: Thekkinkadu Maidan, the main venue of the Pooram, is all decked up. The annual exhibition is on and the construction of pandals is progressing at three locations.

title: Pop done coaching Spurs; Johnson takes over
content: Gregg Popovich is moving to a full-time role in the Spurs' front office, and Mitch Johnson will take over head coaching duties, the team announced Friday.

title: Hammon lauds Popovich, 'super happy' in WNBA
content: After hearing the news that Gregg Popovich would no long coach the Spurs on Friday, Aces coach Becky Hammon lauded "Pop" as a mentor while not ruling out a future move to the NBA.

title: Grizzlies name Iisalo as coach after interim stint
content: The Grizzlies have hired Tuomas Iisalo as the franchise's next head coach after he led Memphis into the playoffs following the late-season firing of Taylor Jenkins.

title: Source: LeBron suffered MCL sprain in G5 loss
content: Lakers star LeBron James suffered a Grade 2 MCL sprain in his left knee in the fourth quarter of Wednesday's Game 5 loss to the Timberwolves, a source told ESPN.

title: O's GM on pitching collapse: 'My responsibility'
content: Orioles general manager Mike Elias took responsibility for the collapse of Baltimore's starting rotation, which has been a factor in the team's struggles this season.

title: Buehler lands on IL due to shoulder inflammation
content: Red Sox right-hander Walker Buehler has inflammation in his pitching shoulder and was placed on the injured list Friday.

title: Rookie Antonelli takes surprise Miami sprint pole
content: Mercedes wonderkid rookie Andrea Kimi Antonelli beat the McLaren drivers to pole position for the sprint race in Miami and in doing so became the youngest polesitter in any Formula 1 format.

title: Clemson PF takes Dabo offer, joins football team
content: Ian Schieffelin has taken up Dabo Swinney on his offer, forgoing any pro basketball prospects for now in favor of one last season in a Clemson jersey -- this time on the gridiron.

title: 🏈 Inside the decision to draft Shedeur Sanders
content: Cleveland didn't have Sanders graded as an elite prospect, but saw him as a steal once he slid to Day 3.

title: What this monumental coaching change means for San Antonio
content: What's next for San Antonio after Pop's move to the front office? What does Mitch Johnson bring? Our NBA insiders break down the news.

title: What the Lakers' early exit tells us about their future with Luka
content: In nearly every way, the Lakers were outclassed by the Wolves. And now, after a disappointingly early exit, their next task is even more important: selling Doncic that this first-round loss was merely an aberration.

title: Handing out April grades for all 30 MLB teams: From many A's to a surprising F
content: Is your favorite team acing -- or flunking -- the early part of the 2025 season? We break it all down.

title: How Wrexham paid their way to promotion, and why the Premier League requires more than that
content: Wrexham's promotion might look miraculous, but it's actually a combination of factors that other Premier League hopefuls shouldn't try to replicate.

title: Diggins 'changed our program': How Notre Dame became the pipeline for some of the WNBA's top guards
content: Eight Notre Dame guards, including 2013 draft pick Skylar Diggins, are expected to make 2025 WNBA rosters.

title: Garcia vs. Romero live updates, results and analysis
content: Three fights in the heart of New York's Times Square, including the return of Ryan Garcia and Devin Haney.

title: An early ranking of Rookie of the Year contenders: Two lists, 34 draft picks
content: Cam Ward, Ashton Jeanty or the field for OROY? Abdul Carter for DROY? And how does Travis Hunter factor in?

title: Luck Index 2025: Who needs luck on their side next season?
content: Turnover luck, coordinator upgrade, transfer portal haul? They all could lead to some upswings for a select few teams.

title: 'We've got the identity that fits us': Wisconsin turns back the clock to move forward
content: Wisconsin coach Luke Fickell is going back to the Badgers' roots in a crucial Year 3 for his program.

title: NBA draft asset rankings: Where OKC's treasure trove and all 30 teams check in
content: Who controls the 2025 NBA draft? What about the next seven? Bobby Marks and Jeremy Woo examine every team's draft future.

title: Slot reveals Klopp message after Prem title win
content: Liverpool head coach Arne Slot has revealed his predecessor Jürgen Klopp reached out to congratulate him after his team won the Premier League title.

title: Madrid or Leverkusen? Alonso says 'we must wait'
content: Bayer Leverkusen coach Xabi Alonso said we must wait until the end of the season for an announcement on his future amid links to Real Madrid.

title: Conte: McTominay better now than at Man United
content: Napoli manager Antonio Conte said Scott McTominay has become a more complete and knowledgeable player since joining from Manchester United last summer.

title: Maguire: Utd owe fans a trophy after poor season
content: Harry Maguire has said Manchester United's players feel they owe the fans a trophy to repay their faith during a miserable season in the Premier League.

title: Sources: Dembélé optimistic of return vs. Arsenal
content: PSG forward Ousmane Dembélé is optimistic that he will be fit to play against Arsenal on Wednesday, sources have told ESPN.

title: Mascherano: Miami 'clearly Messi-dependent'
content: Inter Miami coach Javier Mascherano laughed off suggestions his team was too dependent upon Lionel Messi and insisted they will bounce back stronger when they host New York Red Bulls in MLS action following a tough CCL elimination.

title: Flick on Yamal: Hard work to top Messi, Ronaldo
content: Barcelona coach Hansi Flick said on Friday that Lamine Yamal must work hard and continue to replicate his Inter Milan performance to reach the level of Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi.

title: Pep 'sure' he'll 'take a break' when he leaves City
content: Pep Guardiola has told ESPN he is "sure" he is going to take a break from management when he leaves Manchester City.

title: In its spell as F1 host, Miami has become America's Monaco
content: A good F1 venue goes beyond on-track action, and when it comes to spectacle and fun, Miami is second to none.

title: Will a serious focus on health bring horse racing fans back?
content: The Horseracing Integrity and Safety Authority (HISA) has a plan to keep the industry healthy with increased regulations. Will it work?

title: Betting the 151st Kentucky Derby: What you need to know to make a smart race wager
content: The basics and insider intel you need to sound smart while betting the most exciting two minutes in sports.

title: Relevent-USSF settlement: Are foreign leagues coming to America?
content: Settling its suit against U.S. Soccer, Relevent can now bring foreign games to the U.S. Is MLS under threat?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid want Alexander-Arnold before Liverpool deal ends
content: Real Madrid want to sign TAA for the Club World Cup before his Liverpool contract ends. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Latest rosters for 90+ teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're tracking all personnel movement for key teams heading into 2025-26.

content: Matt Bowen provides his analysis of this year's rookie class in fantasy, in terms of redraft and dynasty value.

title: Over 30,000 Pilgrims Visit Kedarnath Dham On 1st Day
content: more than 30,000 devotees visited the Kedarnath temple on friday, according to official data . a band of the Indian Army's Garhwal Rifles played devotional tunes on the occasion . the gates open on fridaday, and a prasad is distributed to the devotee .

title: Grand Theft Auto VI release date revealed
content: "we are very sorry that this is later than you expected," developer says . "the interest and excitement surrounding a new Grand Theft Auto has been truly humbling for our entire team," developer said . the next iteration of rockstar's urban crime role-playing game is one of the most hotly anticipated video games of all time .

title: Where does Bo Nickal rank among MMA's undefeated fighters?
content: a select few undefeated fighters in professional MMA stand out from the pack . unbeaten fighters like Bo Nickal and Michael Morales are still rising prospects . morales faces Gilbert Burns in the main event at UFC Fight Night on sunday .

title: What must Liverpool address in summer transfer window?
content: Virgil van Dijk, Mohamed Salah and Trent Alexander-Arnold would have to face tough negotiations with three of their top players . the trio won the premier league by a sizeable margin, two of the big free agents extended the league . they'd have to do it off the back of £57 million in losses .

title: Wetzel: Never mind the girlfriend kerfuffle. Belichick will always be fine.
content: belichick is arguably the greatest coach in the history of the sport . his jump to the college ranks and the University of North Carolina is of great intrigue . he's running point on publicity for his new book, "The Art of Winning: Lessons from My Life in Football"

title: Expert picks, best bets: How Sandhagen gets past Figueiredo at UFC Fight Night
content: cory Sandhagen takes on former men's flyweight champion deiveson Figueiredo in main event at UFC Fight Night in Des Moines, Iowa . the bantamweight contender is aiming to bounce back from his first loss since 2023 . he was riding a three-fight win streak before dropping that fight .

title: Five rookies with breakout potential
content: the WNBA is a hard league to break into, but rookies are making an impact earlier than ever . in 2023, I recommended not drafting any rookies that weren't the overall no. 1 pick, Aliyah Boston . the 2024 draft class was an outlier from previous history; all four lottery picks averaged over 20 fantasy points per game .
